{"document_id": "Kaggle::techmap::614c2e3bbfb8e7511d3a5d7e::careerbuilder_us", "source": "careerbuilder_us", "country": "US", "company": "The Jel Sert Company", "position": "Safety Representative", "notes": "", "original": "

For nearly a century, The Jel Sert Company has focused on creating high-quality, high-value foods, and beverages that help bring people together. We are currently looking for a passionate and dedicated individual to join our team as a SAFETY REPRESENTATIVE. If you are looking for a work environment that encourages personal growth, responsibility, and a shared vision for creating incredible products that help create lasting memories, then Jel Sert wants you!

The  SAFETY REPRESENTATIVE will work closely with our EHS Coordinator by maintaining a variety of safety, health and/or environmental programs to ensure practical, cost-effective measures are in place within the workplace to continuously improve our safety culture and to assure the highest possible degree of safety for employees.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Coordinate and provide safety training programs for new employees along with monthly and annual required programs.
  • Projects may vary between Personal Protective Equipment assessments, Safety Data Sheet organization, GHS labeling, training organization and improvements, chemical inventories, lab equipment safety, and/or procedure updates.
  • Ensures OSHA compliance through auditing required programs such as powered industrial trucks (forklift), confined spaces, LOTO, fire extinguishers, hearing tests, and other programs.
  • Identify and evaluate hazardous conditions, compliance, and practices during on-site inspections and audits.
  • Ensure corrective action processes are in place for responding to and correcting safety audit findings.
  • Compiles required safety reports, statistics, and other data as requested.
  • Coordinate and actively participate in monthly safety committee meetings.
  • Administrate timecards as needed for employees on worker’s compensation leave, medical treatment/therapy/etc. that may occur during the work shift.
  • Assist in the monitoring of employees to ensure they are adhering to the following practices upon the arrival and during their shift:
    • Completion of Health Screening Form
    • Monitoring of employee’s temperature through our infrared temperature measurement system
    • Enforce wearing of PPE’s within the workplace
    • Monitor and enforce social distancing
    • Ensure workspaces and common areas are routinely disinfected
  • Performs other duties and/or assignments as directed.

QUALIFICATIONS 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • Bilingual Spanish is required, with the ability to communicate both verbally and written.
  • General knowledge of occupational safety within a manufacturing environment is a plus!
  • Previous coursework and training in Occupational Safety Requirements, Environmental, Safety & Occupational Health Management and/or OSHA guidelines are preferred.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES

  • Experience presenting effectively to groups of people.
  • Ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues by using sound judgment that is consistent with company standards, practices, procedures, regulations, or laws.
  • Effective communication skills, verbal/written, and presentation skills.
  • Work well in a team setting, as well as individually with minimal supervision.
  • Flexibility to work outside regular business hours, including 2nd or 3rd shift hours, in order to meet business needs.
  • Ability to positively engage employees in support of safe work practices.
  • Have strong analytical, organizational, interpersonal skills, and be a self-starter.
  • Possesses a continuous improvement mindset and strong problem-solving skills.
  • Established as a credible and trustworthy leader.
  • Maintains a high level of confidentiality.
  • Strong computer skills, including the ability to create and maintain spreadsheets and effectively put a presentation together.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS 

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Climbing: Ascending or descending ladders, stairs, and the like, using feet and legs and/or hands and arms.
  • Balancing: Maintaining body equilibrium to prevent falling when walking, standing or crouching on narrow, slippery or erratically moving surfaces.
  • Stooping: Bending body downward and forward by bending spine at the waist.
  • Kneeling: Bending legs at knee to come to a rest on knee or knees.
  • Crouching: Bending the body downward and forward by bending the leg and spine.
  • Crawling: Moving about on hands and knees or hands and feet.
  • Reaching: Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.
  • Standing: Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time.
  • Walking: Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for long distances or moving from one work site to another.
  • Pushing: Using upper extremities to press against something with steady force in order to thrust forward, downward or outward.
  • Pulling: Using upper extremities to exert force in order to draw, drag, haul or tug objects in a sustained motion.
  • Lifting: Raising objects from a lower to a higher position or moving objects horizontally from position to position.
  • Fingering: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with whole hand or arm as in handling.
  • Grasping: Applying pressure to an object with the fingers and palm.
  • Feeling: Perceiving attributes of objects, such as size, shape, temperature or texture by touching with skin, particularly that of fingertips.
  • Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
  • Hearing: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound.
  • Repetitive motions: Making substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.
  • Medium work: Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up-to 20 pounds of force frequently, and/or up-to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.
  • The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection).
  • The worker is required to have visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned or to make general observations of facilities or structures and be able to discern differences between red/green/amber.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

This position will work between the Manufacturing and office environment.  One can expect to be out on the manufacturing floor up to 50% of their time.  Will need to be available to spend time on all 3 shifts when required. Work hours are very flexible.

FOOD SAFETY and QUALITY RESPONSIBILITIES

Follow applicable procedures and work instructions.

Back up EHS Coordinator

IMPACT ON JEL SERT SUCCESS

This job is essential to ensure that Jel Sert is adhering to and following safety regulations and standards through continuous and proactive communication with Jel Sert manufacturing and warehouse operations employees and management. Also plays a key role in working towards minimizing worker’s compensation costs through administration of claims and communications with affected employees.
